alert.note: Alert for Charles City; City of Williamsburg; James City; Prince George; Surry; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 12:47PM EDT until August 28 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Charles City County in east central Virginia... East Central Prince George County in south central Virginia... James City County in southeastern Virginia... Surry County in southeastern Virginia... Northwestern York County in southeastern Virginia... The City of Williamsburg in southeastern Virginia... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 1247 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Williamsburg, Claremont, Toano, Norge, Rustic, Cabin Point, Governors Land, Mount Airy, Centerville, Warren Mill, Brandon, Diascund, Spring Grove, Lightfoot, Ewell, Taylors Corner, Croaker, Barlows Corner, Oaktree and Savedge. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; City of Williamsburg; James City; Prince George; Surry; York
